//GRADE 7 What agency of the Philippines government observes typhoons via weather satellite? Philippine Weather Administration National Weather Administration PHIVOLCS PAGASA PAGASA
What tropical cyclone carries a wind velocity of more than 220 kph ? tropical depression super typhoon tropical storm typhoon super typhoon
When public storm raises to signal no.3. the expected wind velocity of the tropical cyclone is ? 62-88 kph 39-61 kph 89-117 kph 185-above 60kph 89-117 kph
What part of tropical cyclone brings great damage to property? rainbands lightning eyewall eye eyewall
Why does PAGASA announces public storms signals in advance? so that people can prepare for the possible effects of the tropical cyclone so that people can buy extra goods for the family so that people can plan for their activities so that people can rest at home so that people can prepare for the possible effects of the tropical cyclone
How does rotation of the Earth affect the nature of tropical cyclones? It proves a favorable venue for the formation of a tropical cyclone It intensifies the wind velocity of a tropical cyclone It deflects the motion of a tropical cyclone It weakens a tropical cyclone It proves a favorable venue for the formation of a tropical cyclone
Which does not include in this list? Tropical typhoon Tropical cyclone Tropical storm Storm surge Storm surge
In which of the following situations will the strength of a tropical cyclone probably weaken? When it travels on bodies of water When it is still in the warm ocean When it travels outside the par When it makes a landfall When it makes a landfall
Rather than following in a straight line from the polar region to the equator, winds are deflected due to the ____________. Earth’s topography Earth’s atmosphere Earth’s gravity Coriolis effect Coriolis effect
What is the BEST thing to do when there is a tropical typhoon? Ignore the weather condition and just go on with usual routines Stay at home and prepare for the effects of the typhoons Organize an outing with the family All of the above Stay at home and prepare for the effects of the typhoons
SelectedOption CorrectAnswer
//GRADE 8 Do you think the destructive effects of a tropical cyclone can be mitigated through preparations ? TRUE, because by being prepared we can help to prevent or minimize the damages that will occur. Thus, leading ourselves to safety. FALSE, I don’ think that is the case. There are better alternatives for this part. We can just carry on with our daily routines. Maybe None of the Above TRUE,because by being prepared we can help to prevent or minimize the damages that will occur.Thus,leading ourselves to safety.
The occurrence of a tropical cyclone can be predicted.Hence,there is no need to worry and prepare ahead of time,right? TRUE,since we can anticipate it. Why prepare when we can just wait for the it and do something about the typhoon afterwards.
FALSE, whether we can predict it or not it’s always best to be prepare things or having a backup plan if things went not according as plan. Maybe None of the above FALSE,whether we can predict it or not it’s always best to be prepare things or having a backup plan if things went not according as plan. It’s better to be safe than sorry.
Panic-Buying of goods is advisable in times of calamities TRUE,since buying foods at times of need is essential and having a scarce food is not right especially since there is a calamity. FALSE,panic buying will the increase of products getting sold out quickly and results into getting few products or none. It’s best to buy ahead of time and stack the goods that has longer expiration date so that when calamity occurs we don’t have to risk ourselves to go outside. Maybe None of the above FALSE, panic buying will the increase of products getting sold out quickly and results into getting few products or none. It’s best to buy ahead of time and stack the goods that has longer expiration date so that when calamity occurs we don’t have to risk ourselves to go outside.
Do you think coordinating with the local authorities will greatly help in the preparation for the possible effects of a typhoon. TRUE,since working with local authorities will help us be updated with the news and further improve the speed of the performance in preparing for the typhoon FALSE,since there is no need for that and just focus on your own. Maybe None of the Above TRUE, since working with local authorities will help us be updated with the news and further improve the speed of the performance in preparing for the typhoon
Is it safe to stay inside the car during floodwater? YES, since we can just stay inside and wait for rescue NO,because we will get trapped inside the car and drowning ourselves to death should the water get inside. Maybe None of the Above NO,because we will get trapped inside the car and drowning ourselves to death should the water get inside.
It is the measure of how much damage an earthquake causes the surfaces? Intensity Volcanic Earthquake Magnitude Richer sale Intensity
It is an earthquake associated with volcanic activities? Intensity Volcanic Earthquake Magnitude Richer sale Volcanic Earthquake
It is the area where rocks first break. Intensity Volcanic Earthquake Focus Richer sale Focus
It is the point on the ground’s surface directly above the focus Intensity Volcanic Earthquake Focus Richer sale Focus
It refers to a vibration of the crust due to sudden releases of energy Intensity Volcanic Earthquake Focus Earthquake Earthquake
SelectedOption CorrectAnswer
//GRADE 9 It refers to the measure of the energy released by an earthquake Intensity Magnitude Focus Earthquake Magnitude
It measures the magnitude of an earthquake Richer scale Surface waves Seismologist Magnitude Richer scale
These are the seismic waves that causes damage when an earthquake occurs. Richer scale Surface waves Seismologist Magnitude Surface waves
It refers to a scientist who studies earthquakes. Seismologist Surface waves Seismologist Magnitude Seimoslogist
This is an earthquake that is caused by movements of tectonic plates. Tectonic earthquake Surface waves Seismologist Magnitude Tectonic earthquake
If you are driving when an earthquake happens, should you continue to keep driving the car? YES, so that we can escape from the earthquake NO, stop the car carefully and make sure you are not in a place like traffic, bridges, overpass, light post, or under trees. Until the shaking stops, stay inside your car. Maybe None of the Above NO, stop the car carefully and make sure you are not in a place like traffic, bridges, overpass, light post, or under trees. Until the shaking stops, stay inside your car.
If you are in bed when an earthquake strikes, should you use a pillow over your head. YES, since it is soft and lightweight it’s much better rather than using hard objects to protect me NO, since it offers no protection at all and your head would likely get damaged by a falling debris Maybe None of the above NO,since it offers no protection at all and your head would likely get damaged by a falling debris
If you are outside when an earthquake strikes, move away from building and utility views. YES, and go to the open place so that we can avoid falling debris and potential hazard NO, since going to the building is preferable because there are people there meaning they can help you Maybe None of the Above YES, and go to the open place so that we can avoid falling debris and potential hazard
Earthquakes do not pose threats to people and buildings. YES, since they will only shake the people and the building what harm can it cause NO, since earthquake is one of the deadliest calamities ever reported in the history along with tsunamis. Maybe None of the above YES, since they will only shake the people and the building what harm can it cause
Earthquakes do pose threats to people and buildings. True, that is why we have to prepare counter measures False, it is unpredictable Maybe None of the above True, that is why we have to prepare counter measures
SelectedOption CorrectAnswer
//GRADE 10 You can play in floodwaters if you are a good swimmer Yes,because we wont drown No,due to the floods contamination Maybe None of the Above No,due to the floods contamination
Is a vent or an opening in the ground which has hot gases, rocks and lava ejected Volcano Ring of Fire Cinder Cone Volcano None of the Above Volcano
Many volcanoes on Earth are found are called The Pacific Ring of Fire Vent Islands Underwater The Pacific Ring of Fire
Is a circular depression around a vent Crater Vent Magma Chamber Lava Lava
When magma is expelled out of the volcano in the Earths surface Cinder Cone Volcano Magma Chamber Lava Crater Lava
Volcanoes are said to be _____ if they have erupted already Dormant Active Dangerous Extinct Active
Volcanoes can be classified _____ if they erupted before and became inactive for a long of period of time Dormant Active Extinct None of the Above Dormant
Volcanoes are considered to be ____ if there no records of their activity Extinct Dormant Active None of the Above Extinct
During Volcanic eruption: Which of the following is not belong? Seek cover in case of ash falls and rock falls Avoid low lying places due to lava flows and mudflows Go near the activity in order to assess the situation None of the Above Go near the activity in order to assess the situation
Which of the following generally handles disasters-related problem DSWD PAGASA PHIVOLCS NDRRMC NDRRMC
